intro: Onobrychis oshnaviyehensis, commonly known as the Oshnaviyeh burclover, is a rare flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a source of forage for local wildlife and its potential in ecological restoration projects.
